question.title: sonar failed: An API incompatibility was encountered while executing org.sonarsource.scanner.maven:sonar-maven-plugin
question.body:
I used sonar-maven-plugin 3.11.0.3922 on a java program which was compiled with jdk1.8.0_391_x64, but got the "sonar failed: An API incompatibility was encountered while executing org.sonarsource.scanner.maven:sonar-maven-plugin". I had tried this:

<properties>
<sonar.java.jdkHome>C:\APPS\Java\jdk1.8.0_391_x64</sonar.java.jdkHome>
</properties>

The full ERROR is:

    >
    [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.sonarsource.scanner.maven:sonar-maven-plugin:3.11.0.3922:sonar (default-cli) on project b-common: Execution default-cli of goal org.sonarsource.scanner.maven:sonar-maven-plugin:3.11.0.3922:sonar failed: An API incompatibility was encountered while executing org.sonarsource.scanner.maven:sonar-maven-plugin:3.11.0.3922:sonar: java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: org/sonar/batch/bootstrapper/EnvironmentInformation has been compiled by a more recent version of the Java Runtime (class file version 55.0), this version of the Java Runtime only recognizes class file versions up to 52.0

question_comments.body: If you need to stick to JDK 8 runtime you have to downgrade the Sonar Plugin aswell as your server which I doubt is the way to go... The simplest solution is to use a more recent JDK (17, 21, 25?) and configuration product JDK 8 (--release) and also upgrade the Sonar plugin to the appropriate level...otherweise that will not work... If the team has decided that ... this decision is simply wrong. They have to reconsider the decision....
Is this a problem for everyone on your team or only for yourself? If someone else on the team solved it, how did they do?
Try using an older plugin version that's still compatible with Java 8. However, that may not work with the Sonar server; both at work and the cloud server I use require Java 17+.
That seems to mean you canâ€™t run the Sonar plugin? (Lucky you ;-)
I cannot use a more recent JDK nor another version for sonar-maven-plugin. The versions allowed are my IT team's decision.

This is the problem: EnvironmentInformation has been compiled by a more recent version of the Java Runtime (class file version 55.0), this version of the Java Runtime only recognizes class file versions up to 52.0 [ERROR .... You should use a more recent JDK and defined --release to produce JDK8 code..
